project.teaser: SHIFT2DC project aims to propose and implement a top-down application-agnostic approach for the design, simulation, test, validation, and application of both medium (MV) and low voltage (LV) direct current (DC) solutions. Thirty-two partners, including affiliated and...
project.objective: SHIFT2DC project aims to propose and implement a top-down application-agnostic approach for the design, simulation, test, validation, and application of both medium (MV) and low voltage (LV) direct current (DC) solutions. Thirty-two partners, including affiliated and associated partners, from twelve countries, will join expertise to develop, test and demonstrate the technical feasibility, cost-benefit, life cycle and environmental impact of the proposed DC solutions in Data centres, Buildings, Industry and Ports across Europe (Germany, France, and Portugal). The field-tests and demonstrators will allow an evaluation of the advanced control methodologies and tools, the definition of the appropriate implementation conditions, and a consolidation of the most promising solutions and corresponding business models for MV and LV DC systems. Beyond the DC solutions that will be tested and demonstrated, SHIFT2DC will also evaluate the consumers´perspective regarding DC solutions and propose new tools that promote the faster adoption of DC solutions. All the solutions and tools that will be developed in the SHIFT2DC project will be case-agnostic allowing the use of its results in most applications. In a second stage of the development, specific libraries for buildings, datacentres, industry and ports will be proposed allowing a better and more detailed simulation of the mentioned environments. The DC solutions proposed and developed in the SHIFT2DC project will be designed taking into consideration the interoperability requirements, the scalability opportunities and the security and privacy needs. In addition, the project results will contribute to the development of standards in compliance with the needs of DC solutions. Finally, a regulatory framework that promotes the adoption of MVDC and LVDC solutions and assures secure and economic power systems management under hybrid AC/DC grids will be proposed.
project.title: SHIFT to Direct Current
project.keywords: DC Systems, MVDC, LVDC, AC, DC grids, Data Centres, Ports, Buildings, Industry, DC Living Labs, Digital Twin, DC Cables, Standardisation, Guidelines, DC Energy Hubs, Electric Vehicle Charging Station

article.title: From AC- to DC-powered data centres, ports, industry and buildings

result.title: Project Management Plan - Updated
result.description: D7.2 will include the updates on the SHIFT2DC Project Management strategy to be followed by the SHIFT2DC consortium.

result.title: User adoption of DC solutions
result.description: D1.6 will include the main results of the analysis of the user perspective of the adoption and use of DC solutions.

result.title: Policies, Regulatory framework, and Market Architecture for DC solutions
result.description: D1.2 will include an assessment of the existing policies and regulatory framework identifying the main barriers and providing first recommendations.

result.title: Specification of DC solutions, tools and devices
result.description: D1.4 will include the main specifications of tools and devices that will be developed in WP2 and WP3, and tested in WP4.

result.title: Use Case Repository
result.description: D1.3 will be a use case repository including the use cases that will be tested in the demonstrators

result.title: DC solutions design tool
result.description: D2.1 will be a tool allowing the design of MVDC and LVDC solutions and assessment of these solutions.

result.title: IT requirements for DC solutions (Demonstrators)
result.description: D1.5 will address the main IT requirements to be implemented in during the demonstrators.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: D6.1 will include the SHIFT2DC dissemination and communication strategies.

result.title: DC protection systems design tool
result.description: D2.2 will be a tool allowing the design of protection systems of MVDC and LVDC systems.

result.title: Detailed specification of the demonstrators
result.description: D4.1 will include the detailed specification of the 4 demonstrators. The results of the demonstrators’ design should be also presented in the deliverable.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: D7.4 will include the SHIFT2DC Data Management guidelines to be followed by the consortium.

result.title: DC Applications, Challenges, Opportunities and Evolution Scenarios
result.description: D1.1 will include a first vision concerning the existing DC applications, the main challenges and opportunities, and the expected evolution scenarios

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
